docs.title: What do I need to know?

skills.name: HTML
skills.description: Hypertext Markup Language, used to describe the content of webpages.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: Cascading Style Sheets, used to style webpages.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JavaScript, a programming language used on webpages and in browsers.

skills.name: React
skills.description: A JavaScript view library open-sourced by Facebook.

skills.name: Documentation
skills.description: Writing documentation for developers and users.

skills.name: WebExtensions
skills.description: A cross-browser system for developing browser add-ons.

repos.name: Test Pilot
repos.description: Test Pilot's own website and add-on.

repos.name: Snooze Tabs
repos.description: Right website, wrong time? Snooze it until you need it. Snooze Tabs let you dismiss tabs now and set an alarm to open them later.

repos.name: Containers
repos.description: Contain yourselves! Create different containers for each of your online lives - your work self, your social self, your personal self - to stay organized and maintain privacy.

repos.name: Pulse
repos.description: Give us a performance review. Add Pulse, and help us understand which websites work well in Firefox and which sites donâ€™t.

repos.name: Page Shot
repos.description: Intuitive screenshots baked right into the browser. Capture, save and share screenshots as you browse the Web using Firefox.

repos.name: Activity Stream
repos.description: A rich visual history feed and a reimagined home page make it easier than ever to find exactly what you're looking for in Firefox.

repos.name: Min Vid
repos.description: Keep videos front and center. Min Vid lets you display YouTube and Vimeo videos in a small frame that stays in the foreground as you browse the web.

repos.name: Tab Center
repos.description: What would it be like to move tabs from the top of the browser to the side? We wanted to find out!
